sense.name: act of conveyance or distribution
sense.examples: Their service makes two scheduled deliveries a day. Allow 5 to 7 days for delivery. They can track the entire process of delivery on computer. They are in charge of the delivery of prisoners to the maximum security prison. I paid extra for overnight delivery. Our condominium association has arranged for delivery of natural gas to the building at a fixed price.

sense.name: process of childbirth
sense.examples: Very few forceps deliveries are performed nowadays. Sally had a rough delivery of her twin boys. The obstetrician said it would be a breech delivery.

sense.name: a performing style, as in speaking or singing
sense.examples: Her delivery of the speech was cool and confident. The diva's rendition of Donizetti arias had almost a folk singer's casual delivery.

sense.name: the act of legal transfer, as of a deed
sense.examples: We are still waiting for delivery of the title to that property. John bought corn futures for delivery in June. (ownership) the corn is not brought to your house - yet!)

sense.name: the act of throwing a baseball
sense.examples: The batter positions himself and waits for the delivery. The pitcher's delivery was just over the inside corner for a strike.

sense.name: the rescue or release of someone, something
sense.examples: The phone call was Mary's delivery from the long, boring meeting. The rains finally came, bringing delivery to the parched crops.

sense.name: parcels or packages that are conveyed
sense.examples: They will not handle deliveries that weigh more than forty pounds. I noticed a delivery on your porch this morning. Don't accept or open deliveries from unknown persons.
